title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax incentives for the production of qualified hybrid motor vehicles.
content: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow tax credits for purchasers and manufacturers of qualified hybrid motor vehicles. Defines qualified hybrid motor vehicle as a motor vehicle which: (1) operates on an internal combustion or heat engine using consumable fuel and a rechargeable energy storage system, (2) meets specified emission standards under the Clean Air Act. (3) is a passenger vehicle or light truck with a gross weight rating of not more than 8,500 pounds. (4) has a maximum available power of at least four percent. And (5) is acquired for use or lease by a taxpayer and not for resale.
